solution.text: In the previous question we calculated that the probability of the number having two zeroes was 0.01. Therefore the probability of the number not having two zeroes is 1 - 0.01 = 0.99. Clearly, there is a much higher probability of the number not having two zeroes and so your answer to the question should be NO.

content.text: Based on the probability you calculated, would you guess that the number has two zeroes?

incorrect.text: YES, the number probably has two zeroes.

correct.text: NO, the number probably doesn't have two zeroes.
